description: From Middle English pocioun, borrowed from Old French pocion, from Latin pōtiō (“a drinking”), potiōnis, from pōtāre (“to drink”). Doublet of poison.

entries.meaning: A small portion or dose of a liquid which is medicinal, poisonous, or magical.
examples: He hoped to win the princess's heart by mixing the love potion the witch gave him into her drink.

verbs.description: potion (third-person singular simple present potions, present participle potioning, simple past and past participle potioned)
